difficulty level easy materials and tools 1 yarn recommended yarnart jeans 55%cotton/45%pac 160m*50g 174yds*1 76oz in colors sand col a #07 light yellow/lemon col b #67 turquoise col c #81 blue or light blue col d #15 or #75 2 stuffing 3 hook size 2mm us 4 4 scissors pins markers tapestry needle needle for sewing abbreviations yo yarn over st/sts stitch/stitches blo back loop only flo front loop only single_crochet single_crochet stitch chain chain stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch parentheses are used for repeated patterns of stitches used for making patterns of stitches in one stitch size for recommended materials length 7cm/2 8 this pattern is available in video tutorial too how to crochet éclair flounder 2 éclair flounder free crochet pattern by @leta toyfox éclair worked in row start with sand yarn note i started with 21ch but optionally you can make more starting chains to get your cake longer row 1 21ch from the 2nd chain from the hook 20sc 20 row 2 1ch turn blo 20sc 20 row 3-4 1ch turn blo 2ss 16sc 2ss 20 row 5-6 1ch turn blo 20sc 20 switch to light yellow yarn row 7-8 1ch turn blo 20sc 20 row 9-10 1ch turn blo 2ss 16sc 2ss 20 row 11-12 1ch turn blo 20sc 20 row 13-14 1ch turn blo 2ss 16sc 2ss 20 fasten_off and switch to sand yarn row 15-16 1ch turn blo 20sc 20 row 17-18 1ch turn blo 2ss 16sc 2ss 20 row 19-20 1ch turn blo 20sc 20 cut the yarn leaving long tail for sewing fold detail so that first row and last row matched sew edges together from stitch to stitch put the needle through braids from one side tight the hole carefully stuff eclair not very densely attach thread to any stitch from another side put it through braids and tight the hole whipped cream stripes make 2 short stripes and 1 long stripe all worked with turquoise yarn don t stuff for long stripe make 11ch from the 2nd chain from the hook 10sc continue across the row as follows 1ch 1ss in 1st front loop 1ch 1ss in 1st chain turn the item 90 degrees 1ch 1ss in next free chain 1ch 1ss in next free front loop turn the item 90 degrees continue inserting hook in front loops of row 1 and starting chains alternately till row 1 ends cut the yarn leaving a long tail for sewing
